article.headline: Texas Southern 58, MVSU 55
article.story: HOUSTON -- Travele Jones scored 17 points and Texas Southern hung on to defeat MVSU 58-55 in overtime on Monday night, avenging its only conference loss of the season. Texas Southern (15-10, 13-1 SWAC) led 26-24 at halftime, but MVSU led for most of the first half and did not trail in the last 15 minutes of the second half. The Delta Devils led 46-40 before the Tigers scored six straight to tie it, with Jones' jumper making it 46-all. Harrison Smith's dunk for the Tigers with 1:16 left tied it at 50. Smith scored first in overtime and Texas Southern never trailed again. Kevin Galloway made two free throws with 10 seconds left to make it 58-55, and Smith blocked William Pugh's shot in the final seconds, giving the Tigers their seventh straight victory. D'Angelo Jackson led the Delta Devils (11-17, 10-5) with 21 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
